target_audience.primary_persona: Czech medical professionals (doctors, physicians) working in clinical settings who need quick evidence-based answers to clinical questions
secondary_personas: Medical students seeking reliable clinical reference
Healthcare IT integrators connecting EHR systems
pain_points: Time-consuming search for evidence-based medical information across multiple sources
Difficulty verifying drug insurance coverage (VZP) quickly during patient consultations
Lack of AI tools that understand Czech medical terminology and context
Complex process of tracking SUKL regulatory changes and drug alerts
Manual epicrisis writing and medical documentation tasks
Language barriers when reading international medical literature
goals: Get evidence-based clinical answers within seconds during patient consultations
Quickly verify VZP insurance coverage for medications and procedures
Stay updated on SUKL regulatory changes and drug safety alerts
Save time on administrative tasks like epicrisis writing
Access PubMed citations with Czech language support
target_audience.usage_context: Used during clinical practice in Czech healthcare settings - hospitals, clinics, and private practices. Primary use during patient consultations, prescription decisions, and clinical documentation. Accessible via web browser with potential for EHR integration.

product_vision.one_liner: AI asistent nove generace pro ceske lekare - providing evidence-based clinical answers with Czech language support and local regulatory integration
product_vision.problem_statement: Czech medical professionals struggle to quickly access evidence-based information during patient consultations. They must navigate multiple sources (PubMed, SUKL, VZP), deal with language barriers in international literature, and manually verify local regulatory compliance - all while managing patient care time constraints.
product_vision.value_proposition: Czech MedAI is the only AI clinical assistant specifically designed for Czech healthcare, combining evidence-based answers from 29M+ scientific articles with native Czech language support, real-time VZP insurance verification, SUKL regulatory integration, and EHR connectivity - all within seconds.
success_metrics: Number of active monthly users (target: 1000+ doctors)
Number of clinical queries per user per month

existing_features: AI Chat interface with Czech language support
User authentication with Supabase (login, register, password reset)
Responsive design with Radix UI components
FastAPI backend with drug search endpoints
LangGraph agent architecture for AI responses
known_gaps: Team account management for Premium tier
technical_debt: CORS configured with allow_origins=['*'] - needs restriction for production
History interface click handler incomplete (console.log TODO)
No E2E testing suite (recently started planning)
Backend tests exist but frontend tests missing

alternatives: OpenAI ChatGPT (general) - not specialized for medicine
Google Bard/Gemini (general) - not specialized for Czech healthcare
differentiators: Native Czech language support with medical terminology
Integration with Czech regulatory systems (SUKL, VZP)
Evidence-based citations from PubMed with Czech context
Local EHR integration capability (ICZ, CGM, Medisoft)
GDPR compliant with EU data hosting
competitive_context.market_position: First-mover advantage in Czech healthcare AI assistant market. Targeting an underserved niche where global competitors lack local language support and regulatory integration. Positioned as premium tool for serious clinical use with evidence-based approach.

technical: Dependency on external APIs (OpenAI, PubMed, SUKL, VZP)
Supabase BaaS dependency for auth and database
Need for GDPR-compliant EU data hosting
MDR certification requirements for medical device classification
Rate limiting considerations for API integrations
resources: Single developer (Petr Sovadina) - limited development velocity
SaaS pricing model requiring user acquisition before revenue
Marketing budget constraints for B2B healthcare market
Need for medical domain expertise validation
dependencies: PubMed API for scientific article citations
SUKL API for Czech drug registry data
VZP API for insurance verification data
